text: "Fade Out Lines" is a song by French deep house producer The Avener. It was written by Phoebe Killdeer and Archive / Mineral' singer Craig Walker, was arranged by Phoebe Killdeer and Cedric Le Roux, and was produced by Tristan Casara. The single is a deep house rework of "The Fade Out Line", an original song by Phoebe Killdeer & The Short Straws. Released in September 2014, it was successful in Germany, topping the German Singles Chart and also reaching number 3 in France and number 6 in Italy. It also charted in Belgium, Austria, and Switzerland. ==Music video== A music video to accompany the release of "Fade Out Lines" featuring Fleur Geffrier was first released onto YouTube on 20 October 2014.The Avener, Phoebe Killdeer - Fade Out Lines - YouTube\- Actress Talentbox Profile ==Use in media== The song was used in the German Movie Ostwind 2 (a sequel to Windstorm) from 2015. In June 2017, the song was used in a Peugeot 208 TV advertisement that was broadcast in Portugal.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lea7ys9mIRY In June 2019, the song was featured in the ending credits of season 2, episode 1 of HBO's Big Little Lies. ==Track listing== ==Charts and certifications== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !scope="col"| Chart (2014–15) !scope="col"| Peak position |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- |- ! scope="row"| Italy (FIMI) | style="text-align:center;"| 6 |- |- |- ! scope="row"| Slovenia (SloTop50) | align=center|6 |- |- |- |- |} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !
